text:
-Good morning, Erin.
-Hey.

-Would you mind faxing
this attendance sheet
down to Jo for me?
-Sure.

Oh, is it just
the general fax line,
not her personal one?
-Uh, yeah, Jo's orders.

-[ Gasps ] Did you read
Oscar's blog this morning?
'Cause he wrote about my sign.
-Just posted another one, Erin
-Oh, cool.
-Not at 10:23 a.m. he didn't
-Yes, I have a blog.

It's called "There's No
Accounting for Taste."
[ Chuckles ]

And, uh, it's just anecdotes
about an accountant's life
intermixed with decorating tips.
Our CEO, Jo Bennett,

randomly found it
while Googling employees.

And now it's linked
to the Sabre website.

-Your blog, while work-related
is not work,

so can't have you posting
during business hours.
-Jo gave me a ton of notes

I've been on the phone with her
all morning.
-Jo?

If you want people to know
who you are in this company,

get something posted
on the Sabre website.
Everyone reads it religiously.

Because not only is the site
synonymous with quality,

it is also the mandatory
Internet home page

of every computer
within the company.
Hey, Kelly.

How would you like to be
the very first subject
of my new super-awesome podcast?
-No, thanks.
-Okeydoke.

-There are so many things
you have to worry about

when you want to become
a famous singer.

I totally get what Tina Turner
was going through.

It's like with Oscar's blog,
the Subtle Sexuality blog,

and Erin's Subtle Sexualit
fan blog,

I'm already worried
about overexposure.

If I do Gabe's podcast, will
people say, "Is she a singer

or does she just want
to be famous
for the sake of being famous?"

What I need is, like,
an Iike Turner
to help me make decisions.
-Sabre has a website?

-Yeah, it's supposed to be
your Internet home page.
-Oh, no, no, no, it is.

I love your podcast
on your website.

-Well, my podcast
isn't up yet, so...

But if Oscar can have his blog
on there, then...

-Oscar has a blog?
Okay, this I got to see.

-Okay, that's not
the Sabre website.
-Sure it is.
I like hoops, and I like ladies.

Why am I the only guy
who sees it like this?

-Hey, Meredith,
do you want to do my --

-Hold on one second. Hold on
And boom.

-It is better
than my handwriting.

-What's up, cutie?
-Nothing.

Hey, Kevin?
-What?

-Um, do you want
to do my podcast?
-Yeah, totally.
This is going to be great.

I'm Irish, so I'm a natural
sayer of stories and yarn.

-Here's a ritual that happen
millions of times every day.

[ Stapler clicks ]
Stapling.

Kevin, an accountant,
is doing it right now.

He's been stapling for
as long as he can remember

We all have, but what happens
when we stop for a moment
to ask the big question -- why

-Because these things need
to be stuck to those things.

-Who is going to listen
to this nonsense?

-Angela, a rare instance
of brains and beauty,

a fairy-tale princess
stuck in a tower of paperwork,

stoically spinning receipt
into gold

for the Rumpelstiltskin
we all call "the man."
-Thank you.

-Oscar, how dare you post that
photo of me eating a chili dog
-You gave it to me to post

-Yeah, but she told you
to crop everyone else out.
-I didn't have time, okay?

-Never blog about us again
I'm serious.

Gabe, we're gonna
do your podcast.

-Seriously?
Thank you.

-Yes, I think it would be
a pleasure for all of us.

-Ooh.
-Kevin.
[ Stapler clicks ]

-Okay, first, thank you
for staying after work.

-To tell the truth, I'm not to
excited about staying tonight,

but my sister's having
a Tupperware party.

If I was there, I would
just buy everything up.

-The subject today
is "having it all."

So, what does having it all
mean to you?
-A job and a family.

-Okay, great.
Great answer.
Anyone else?
-A job and a family.
-Okay, good.

[ Laughs ]
No wrong answers, so...

Having it all, what does it mean
to you, Angela?
-The same, a job and a family.

-[ Laughs ]
Sensing a trend.

When we really unpack the text
having it all --
-Job and a family.

That's all anybody ever mean
when they ask,
"Can you have it all?"
Which I have, and it ain't shit.

Hey, wait, I should be saying
this to your cameras, Gabe
Where are your cameras?

-Oh, there is no camera.
This is an audio podcast.

-I showered for this.
-I don't understand.

This has just been
an audio recording?

I would have used my
Scarlett Johansson sexy voice.

[ Deep voice ] I consider
Woody Allen a very dear friend

-Well, I think the site is just
looking for something simple

-No, if we're gonna do this,
we should do this right.

I have video equipment.
I have lights.

I have release forms.
-Please, Gabe, please.

I will do everyone else's
makeup here.
We're gonna look awesome.

I just won't do Creed's
or Meredith's.
-Okay, then.

So I have decided
to do a video podcast.

It's splashier, sort of a "Mee
the Press"/"McLaughlin Group

with the irreverence
of the '80s punk scene.
Classy, refined, edgy, Sabre
Okay, uh, welcome, friends
Today we are going to discuss

what it means to have it all
as a Sabre employee.

We've actually
started shooting already.
-Yes. I'm your sidekick.

-Well, I actually wasn't
planning on having a sidekick.

-[ Laughs ]
Classic, dawg.

Hey, Creed, you know, like
when Jay Leno, he always, like

makes fun of Kevin Eubanks for
masturbating and pot smoking

-I don't know any
of those guys, man.
-Well, I bet you do that, too.
[ Laughs ]
-I will kill you, man.

-Okay, that was
a good rehearsal, guys.
-[ Clapping ]
-Hello, and welcome, friends

to the inaugural podcast
of the Sabre -- Okay.
-I promise I won't say anything.
-[ Sighs ]

Hello, and welcome to
the inaugural podcast
of Sabre's first -- Mm.

Hello.
Please welcome Kelly Kapoor.
[ Guitar plays ]
-Hey.
-Oh.

-"Wave as you enter,
flirt with the host,

tell mildly amusing story,
act surprised when the host asks

about the project
that you're plugging,
and you will be great."

Oh, that is the kind,
sweet Ryan that I love.
[ Cellphone chimes ]
"Push-up bra?"

I was going out to dinner
the other night.

Went to this Mongolian
barbecue place.

Basically they just give you
a bunch of raw food.

You put it in a bowl, and then
they cook it up for you.

But I didn't know this.
My boyfriend didn't tell me.

So I'm just standing there
eating a raw bean sprout,

being like, "They should call
this place Mongolian Salad Bar."
[ Laughter ]
Craziest stuff happens to me
-Please welcome Meredith Palmer.
[ Bell ringing ]

Does anyone have anything to say
about having it all?

Or, hey, even business
in general.

-The problem, Gabe, with
the question of having it all

is that it deals
with externals --
what have I done, what do I own.
None of this matters.

What matters is what's
happening internally,
if you're happy from within.
-That is an amazing answer

-Look at me. I'm the most
content person I know.

And I live in a tent with
a woman made of old soup cans.

-Okay, you know what?
Forget it.

All I wanted was a simple
audio discussion about business,

and instead,
I get this freak show.
-Hey! We are doing you a favor

-It didn't have to be
this complicated.

-You know what? Save it, Gabe.
We're leaving.
-Good.
-Hey.
-What are you doing here, Oscar?

-Well, I had to come back in
to work on my blog.
Jo's been noting me to death
How did this go?
-Good. I'm excited.
-Good.

You know, Gabe,
I've got a minute
if you want to --

-Seriously?
-Yeah.
-You'll do my podcast?

-Yeah, I think
that's a good idea.
-Okay.
Okay. Hello.

I'm sitting here
with Oscar Martinez,

star Sabre blogger.
-Well...

-Oscar, the question is,
can you have it all?
-Nope. Unh-unh.
Not with my damn cameras.
-[ Clicks tongue ]
Grand slam.
